qas.question: What was the original name of Oklahoma City University?

context: The city is home to several colleges and universities. Oklahoma City University, formerly known as <a0_0>Epworth University<a0_0/>, was founded by the United Methodist Church on <a1_0>September 1, 1904<a1_0/> and is renowned for its performing arts, science, mass communications, business, law, and athletic programs. OCU has its main campus in the north-central section of the city, near the city's chinatown area. OCU Law is located in the Midtown district near downtown, in the old Central High School building.
